snippet: Timeless sounds, largely classical and allegro, are chosen from Texas to deter crime and to relieve travelers in one of New York City’s most unappealing places.
abstract: Grace Notes column; tiny-sounding speakers at Pennsylvania Station play stream of classical and 'easy instrumentals' for commuters, supplied by programming company Austin, Tex, whose staff has never set foot in New York City.
lead_paragraph: Timeless sounds, largely classical and allegro, are chosen from Texas to deter crime and to relieve travelers in one of New York City’s most unappealing places.

headline.print_headline: Curating a Polished Playlist for a Shabby Hub
headline.main: Penn Station Is Shabby, but at Least It Sounds Nice
